Halliburton Energy Services Inc, a subsidiary of Halliburton Energy Services Group, which is ultimately owned by Halliburton Co, acquired Wellbore Energy Solutions LLC, a portfolio company of NGP Energy Technology Partners, for an undisclosed amount. TARGET: Baker Hughes, Inc. 
BUYER: Halliburton Co. 
SELLER: Baker Hughes, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 26, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 17, 2014



DEAL NO.: 807436


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

November 13, 2014

Attitude:

Hostile

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Halliburton Co entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Baker Hughes Inc for US$35.2 billion in cash and stock. Under the terms of agreement, Halliburton Co will pay US$19 in cash and will issue 1.12 shares for every target share held. The offer price represents a premium of 40.8% to the stock price of Baker Hughes Inc as of October 10, 2014. The acquisition is expected to be accretive to Halliburton Co's earnings and will be funded through its cash reserves and fully committed debt financing. Completion of the transaction is expected in the second half of 2015, subject to shareholders, regulatory, and other customary conditions. Upon completion of the transaction, Baker Hughes Inc shareholders will own approximately 36% of the combined company. A transaction could realize cost synergies worth up to US$2 billion. Baker Hughes Inc is located in Houston, Texas, United States and provides oil field services. Baker Hughes Inc employs 61,000 staff in more than 80 countries. On November 13, 2014, Halliburton Co confirmed that it is in preliminary discussions to acquire Baker Hughes Inc, for an undisclosed amount. Following the merger, a combined company would become a potent rival to the industry power Schlumberger. On the same day, Baker Hughes Inc disclosed that Halliburton Co threatened to replace its entire board. On November 9, 2014, Baker Hughes Inc CEO, Martin Craighead, announced that its board with the assistance of its advisors, believe that Halliburton Co's proposal does not adequately reflect the value of Baker Hughes Inc and finds the proposal not in the best interest of the company. Baker Hughes Inc cited that it is open to the possibility of the proposal once the outline of key terms is revised and the board considers the offer acceptable. The terms must include a reverse termination fee, the agreement to accommodate all demands of any relevant governments, and a termination fee payable in the event that Halliburton Co's shareholders vote against any transaction. In summary, Baker Hughes Inc is willing to negotiate if the price and terms provide a basis for discussion. On November 12, 2014, Baker Hughes Inc expressed its disappointment to Halliburton Co's undisclosed initial value proposal, and deemed it to be not at an adequate level. Baker Hughes Inc constructively engaged in addressing areas of antitrust risk, and have reached an understanding acceptable to both parties. The target company also responded to Halliburton Co counsel's draft merger agreement by providing a complete markup that Halliburton Co have acknowledged provides a basis for a faster negotiation. But, in response to Baker Hughes Inc's value counterproposal, Halliburton Co continued to be unwilling to improve their first and only proposal. Ridrodsky & Long also announced it is investigating potential legal claims against the board of directors of Baker Hughes Inc. As of February 10, 2015, the U.S. Department of Justice requested more information to be able to ma

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Halliburton Energy Services, a subsidiary of Halliburton, acquired a 26% stake in Petroleum Engineering Services for approximately $34 million (GB20.8m pounds sterling) worth of replacement capital and new funds and represents a partial exit for 3i Plc, Aberdeen, whose 15% shareholding in the company is reduced to 11%. Following both the sale of part of its remaining stake to Halliburton Energy Services and dilution, 3i Plc is left with a 4% interest in the company. Scottish Development held 1% of Petroleum Engineering Services prior to this deal and has now sold out completely.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 17, 2003

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

National-Oilwell acquired the Mono pumping products business of Halliburton Energy Services, a subsidiary of Halliburton Co, for $89.2 million in cash and stock. The business is comprised of Monoflo Inc and Mono Group, the main component of Hallburton Energy Services. The acquisition provides benefits to the Distribution Services Group and Mission products business of National-Oilwell. The acquisition also will improve margins and operating profits for the non-capital business through the in-house manufacturing capability of drilling motor power sections and progressive cavity pumps. The Mono business generated revenues of about $80 million in 2002.

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 17, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Halliburton Co acquired Boots & Coots Inc for US$240.4 million in cash and stock. Halliburton Co paid US$3.00 per share of the target which consists of US$1.72 in cash and issued shares that values Boots & Coots' shares at US$1.28. The transaction represents a 26.1% premium on the closing stock price of Boots & Coots Inc on April 8, 2010. The deal is expected to be accretive in the first full year of Halliburton Co's operations. It would also create a new product service line. Boots & Coots Inc provides pressure control services for oil and gas wells.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 31, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Halliburton Co acquired PSL Energy Services Ltd from Lime Rock Management LP, Bank of Scotland Plc and other shareholders for GBP157.5 million (US$316 million) in cash. In addition, Halliburton Co also took on approximately GBP2 million (US$4 million) of PSL Energy Services Ltd's assumed liabilities. The agreement was subject to receipt of regulatory approvals. PSL Energy Services Ltd provides solutions for well services, process, pipeline and excavation contracts in the UK, Norway, Middle East, Azerbaijan, Algeria and Asia-Pacific locations. The acquisition expands Halliburton Co's market presence in the Eastern Hemisphere. The UK Office of Fair Trading announced on 03 July 2007 that it cleared the acquisition.

DEAL NO.: 93071


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Conglomerate

Closing Date:

April 1, 1996

Deal Description:

Devonport Management Ltd (DML), a private consortium comprising Halliburton Holdings Ltd, the UK parent company of Brown & Root Ltd, the US contractor (51%), the Weir Group Plc, Glasgow, the engineering company (24.5%) and BICC plc, the cable company (24.5%), acquired Devonport Royal Dockyard Plc, Plymouth, the Royal Navy dockyard which it currently manages on behalf of the Ministry of Defence. From completion of the transaction, the dockyard will be owned and operated by Devonport Royal Dockyard Ltd, wholly owned by the DML consortium. Devonport is the UKs largest submarine and warship refitting facility and will become the UKs sole refitting and refuelling location for nuclear powered submarines early next century following modernisation and upgrading of its nuclear facilities. Consideration approximately £40.3m payable in cash on completion.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 27, 2010

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Schlumberger Ltd acquired Smith International Inc for US$9.3 billion in stock. Under the terms of agreement Smith shareholders received 0.6966 shares of Schlumberger in exchange for each Smith share. Upon closing of the transaction, Smith International would be the surviving entity from the merger and Smith International's shareholders would own approximately 12.8% of Schlumberger's outstanding common shares. The deal would allow Schlumberger Ltd to expand their oilfield services. With the deal, Schlumberger would grow its revenue to double that of Halliburton Co, the industries second largest firm in 2010. The deal is in response to Baker Hughes Inc's, the third-largest oilfield services company, in its $6 billion takeover of smaller peer BJ Services Co.

TARGET: Cebo International BV

LAST UPDATE: April 16, 2008

EFFECTIVE DATE: April 19, 2007



DEAL NO.: 411283


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 19, 2007

Deal Description:

Greek minerals group S&B Industrial Minerals SA acquired a 50% minority stake in Cebo International BV from Cementbouw Bindmiddelen & Logistiek BV, a subsidiary of Cementbouw Handel & Industrie BV, for approximately EUR26 million (US$34.24 million). The acquisition is in line with S&B Industrial Minerals SA's expansion strategy. Cebo International BV supplies minerals, chemicals and services to oil and gas companies; it has a production plant at Ijumuiden, the Netherlands and several logistics unit in the Netherlands and the UK. The other 50% stake in Cebo International BV is held by Halliburton Co. The transaction was subject to the approval of relevant authorities and expected to be completed in the first quarter in 2007. In 2006, Cebo International BV generated an annual revenue of about EUR55 million (US$72.53 million) and has about 100 employees. On April 18, 2007, The European Commission cleared the transaction.

DEAL NO.: 462507


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Private. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Financial

Amendment Date:

June 13, 2008

Closing Date:

July 1, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt

Deal Description:

Umbrellastream Ltd, a consortium of companies including Candover Partners, AlpInvest Partners and Goldman Sachs, acquired the remaining 92.2% of Expro International Group Plc for GBP1.6 billion (US$3.2 billion) in cash not already held through a scheme of arrangement. Under the terms of the agreement, Umbrellastream paid GBP16.15 (US$31.42) in cash per each Expro International Group Plc share not already owned by the consortium. The funding for the offer was satisfied by funding from Goldman Sachs International and RBC Capital Markets. Previously, Candover Partners Ltd, Goldman Sachs Capital Partners and AlpInvest Partners NV through Umbrellastream Ltd agreed to acquire, through a revised scheme of arrangement, Expro International Group Plc for GBP1.7 billion (US$3.4 billion) in cash. The original consideration under the scheme of arrangement was for GBP1.6 billion (US$3.1 billion) in cash, on 17 April 2008. Umbrellastream Ltd increased the consideration due to a competing bid proposal for Expro International Group Plc put forth by Halliburton Co. Initially, the tentative acquisition for Expro International Group Plc was launched by Candover Partners Ltd on 29 February 2008, as reported by the Financial Times. Under the revised scheme of arrangement, Umbrellastream Ltd offered to pay GBP15.5 (US$30.71) in cash for every one Expro International Group Plc outstanding share. The original consideration was for GBP14.35 (US$28.35) in cash per each outstanding share of Expro International Group Plc. The original consideration transaction was announced to be financed from funds managed or advised by the consortium led by Candover Partners Ltd, AlpInvest Partners NV and Goldman Sachs Capital Partners, and by a banking syndicate including Royal Bank of Scotland Plc, Lloyds TSB Bank Plc, Royal Bank of Canada, HSBC Plc and DnB NOR Bank ASA. The acquisition was conditional upon the scheme becoming effective by set terms provided in the official offer document. As of July 3, 2008 the shares of Expro International will be delisted and cancelled from trading on the Official List of the London Stock Exchange. Following delisting, Expro will be reregistered as a private company. Umbrellastream Ltd was a company formed for the purpose of the acquisition of Expro. Expro International Group Plc provides products and services that measure, improve, control and process flow from high-value oil and gas wells. The company employs around 4,000 people.
